netgame.tictactoe

Class TicTacToeGameHub

  • java.lang.Object
    • netgame.common.Hub
      • netgame.tictactoe.TicTacToeGameHub

  • public class TicTacToeGameHub
extends Hub
    A "Hub" for the network TicTacToe game. There is only one Hub for a game, and both network players connect to the same Hub. Official information about the state of the game is maintained on the Hub. When the state changes, the Hub sends the new state to both players, ensuring that both players see the same state.

    • Constructor Summary

      TicTacToeGameHub(int port)
      Create a hub, listening on the specified port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicTacToeGameHub

        public TicTacToeGameHub(int port)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Create a hub, listening on the specified port. Note that this method calls setAutoreset(true), which will cause the output stream to each playerTerminal to be reset before sending each message. This is essential since the same state object will be transmitted over and over, with changes between each transmission.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number on which the hub will listen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a listener cannot be opened on the specified port.

    • Method Detail

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived(int playerID,
                   java.lang.Object message)
        Responds when a message is received from a playerTerminal. In this case, the message is applied to the game state, by calling state.applyMessage(). Then the possibly changed state is transmitted to all connected players.
        Overrides:
        messageReceived in class Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - The ID number of the player who sent the message.
        message - The message that was received from the player.

      • playerConnected

        protected void playerConnected(int playerID)
        This method is called when a player connects. If that player is the second player, then the server's listening socket is shut down (because only two players are allowed), the first game is started, and the new state -- with the game now in progress -- is transmitted to both players.
        Overrides:
        playerConnected in class Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - the ID number of the new player.

      • playerDisconnected

        protected void playerDisconnected(int playerID)
        This method is called when a player disconnects. This will end the game and cause the other player to shut down as well. This is accomplished by setting state.playerDisconnected to true and sending the new state to the remaining player, if there is one, to notify that player that the game is over.
        Overrides:
        playerDisconnected in class Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - the ID number of the new player.
